intro: Hamosa trimestris, commonly known as the three-lobed hamosa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America and the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with three distinct lobes and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils near water sources. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
